CoXLxO-Jtvl2Ee2LIqDobA.text: Was taken here for a night as a surprise for my birthday. Great location, handy for the shopping I had to do in the day on Oxford st, a close walk to some amazing restaurants (we went to Hakkasan) and then perfect for the theatre! Absolutely stunning lobby, and cute old fashioned lifts. Also the champagne bar had all the original decor, super luxurious! The old fashioned elements mixed well well the ultra modern reception and rooms. Rooms are large and comfy, quite striking decor. Bathrooms are gorgeous, great shower! Bed was huge and very comfy. And a great service and tea/coffee in the room. We had room service in the room for breakfast, which was really nice and enjoyable. Quite pricey as you would expect. Also lovely little touch, as it was my birthday they offered us a complimentary glass of champagne in the gorgeous champagne room. Nice touch.Overall definitely would stay here again, such a great location for restaurants and theatres. Saves going home to London bridge, and makes the evening special!

A6W55QW2KtEQoDLAvUlyHA.text: I popped into The Bar for a drink while I was waiting for my wife to meet me for dinner.  It looks like a top shelf place, with menus of expensive cocktails to match.  I like the look of the sleek bar and colourful display of liquor bottles on the shelves behind.I was brought some complimentary snacks (chips and nuts) while I looked over the menus.  I opted for only a beer this time, but I am tempted to return to try one of the cocktails.

WDGehoHJuXSIK0MLiUN_Ow.text: We just popped into the ground floor bar for drinks. I'm not sure what else is in the building, but the ground floor also houses a restaurant and some rather swish loos.Cocktails are not inexpensive, but are well made. The whole place has an air of hushed low key grandeur, which I personally enjoy, but it might not be for everyone. Ambience when we visited on a Friday evening at 8.30pm was pretty quiet though.

0xokBdKKpKP8QCiMKZedpg.text: I went to this place for afternoon tea on the Christmas Day. I was so glad that they opened! The café has nice decors and the chairs are very comfy. The service was very professional and the afternoon tea was great. They have three different types of afternoon tea. Two of them are served by the café, which everything will come together. The other one that I had is called High Society afternoon tea, made from the Oscar Wilde bar. This one is more like a three-course meal. Everything comes separately. For what I had yesterday: a savoury muffin came first then some sandwiches. Desserts and scones were at last. Those two types served by the café are cheaper than than the High Society one, which is £47.5 included service. The High Society afternoon tea is only served after 2:00 PM. It has a completely different menu, so make sure you order the right one. Will definitely come back again. Everything was lovely!

photos.caption: Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom. So exquisite!
Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom. Close up
Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom. Desserts

40Ubupuy3di9l74NydPACw.text: From the moment we stepped from the cab, we knew we were in for a treat... We were greeted by name as we exited the cab by a well dressed and friendly young lady. The front desk personnel were friendly and professional without being pretentious .The decor is a mix of old world and modern which somehow makes the old world seem fresh, and the modern elements take on a sense of calm and understated elegance.Our suite had an outstanding view, and in spite of the hotel being almost full, we experienced calm and quiet while in residence.The Carrera marble bathrooms were well appointed with floors that are radiantly heated.The housekeeping services were outstanding and seamless .Mr Sailer ( the Manager) was very informative, friendly, and generous with his time.I highly recommend treating yourself to this experience at least once in your lifetime.

qmXq08CEM30AxIiE3QJhDg.text: Stylish, smart. Art deco. Good menu. Nice cocktails. Also reasonably priced set menu. Very polite and well presented staff. Would go again!

3aj4WZoqtjcb-0PQCJOmzQ.text: This is a perfect place to stay in London. Amazing location, right between Soho, Mayfair and Westminster. The David Chipperfield design is perfection, the tubs and sinks are full marble blocks, the wood floors are classic and the amenities are well thought out.  The staff was amazing, we especially  loved the concierge staff who seemed to know exactly were and when to send us  for the prefect meal.  It was four days of bliss, the only drawback is, I have to go home and back to work.

yRgMigBx2tzfHz_kTOVtcw.text: Wonderful cream tea and lovely pea and mint soup. Very pleasant space with helpful staff.

qbDoYnZcesLWG6c_Il48VA.text: The Cafe Royal is an odd bar and I can't quite make up my mind as to whether I am a fan or not. Some parts are extremely pleasant and others quite the opposite. It features a number of different bar rooms; The Grill Room is decked out in a very old-fashioned way and is the sort of place you would feel happy taking your grandparents for a birthday tea! The Daniel's Bar located downstairs is slightly more lively  for the younger folk and they often have special events including live music and entertainment. It is a great place to escape from the bustle of Regent Street even if you can't benefit from a company paid free bar. The music is low enough that you can hear your conversations and you can just about manage to grab one of the comfy sofas. Prices are not as bad as you'd expect - a spirit and mixer worked out at around £3.I completely expected Cafe Royal to be a tourist haunt as it is so predominant on Regent Street and just has that look about it from the outside. I should not judge a book by its cover however but still feel that it is a somewhat odd and 'fragmented' type place.

photos.caption: Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom

yTg2V2qDOT5iXCJGs5pAhg.text: Absolutely best service I have experienced in London. Beautiful design and of course outstanding location. 5 stars, hands down!

_n2rMpBWYkJjyWJ494qv1Q.text: The Cafe Royal is a bar / venue on Regent Street. When I was dong corporate show booking for Jongleurs, this was one of the venues we were working with.The first feeling I had from this place is that it's pretty huge. There are many floors, each with different bars / venues. The vibe is lush, regency style decor - a little over the top at times but it seems to suit the venue.There are many rooms for hire and the night I was there, the largest room was for the corporate Xmas shows, which included room enough for a comedy stage. Other small rooms where being used for bar areas, hen nights and smaller Xmas parties.It seems like a cool place to have a big old party but I wouldn't go drinking here randomly...

84SgSoJe8VrT7A9FWH1tMQ.text: Love this place. First time I ever had vichyssoise was here. Great food and service you come to expect of a class A establishment. Briilliant!

ZrJSACcgtYi2ClqSZKY4Kg.text: Calling all pleasure-seeking, fun-loving people. This has got to be one of the most fantastic places for events. How would you like it to be? You just say it and your wish comes all alive in grand style. In the heart of the West End, you are bound to be fascinated by this whole new world of experience.

QGZgen_fQd2LnRs-i8CgCA.text: Had a wonderful afternoon tea here at the Oscar Wilde bar. The food was lovely, the atmosphere was so charming and we had the best time! Christian, our server, was extremely friendly and helped us pick the best teas and guided us through a lovely meal. Food & teas were excellent! He made the experience top notch and we would recommend this place to anyone looking for a wonderful afternoon tea! Such a wonderful experience!!

y8PP7vm3twXcYqTbLxJARw.text: Should have wrote this a long time ago. Have stayed here 3 other times in a variety of rooms/suites. It's in the heart of the action in Piccadilly Circus with Mayfair, Soho and Chinatown right beside the hotel.  The rooms are incredibly quiet (that stone is really soundproof along with their windows).  Gorgeous and very functional bathrooms - modern styling mostly.  Only weak spot is their main restaurant is great for breakfast, but average looking for dinner (not many people go here I noticed); however, as mentioned Soho and Chinatown are literally a stone's throw away with over a hundred eateries and Whole Foods behind the hotel so that's no loss at all. I've noted that they are renovating and re-theming this so this might help after April 2018.  The spa and fitness facility are very nice.  It looks like my go to place in London now, have stayed at the Savoy and Mandarin Oriental - can't beat the location, also over top of Piccadilly Circus Tube station - incredibly convenient.

QcxvxF0hfczV9sh_NGlEPg.text: Lovely place to have drinks. The cocktails are very expensive (20 GBP per) but they are well made and come with really interesting snacks. The thing I like most about Café Royal is the ambiance. The bar is gorgeous, the lighting nice, the music smooth, and a really nice change of pace from the incredibly noisy pubs where I can't even have a conversation. Good service, great cocktails, nice ambiance.

GyX9d16viHjR-ibijPH-tg.text: I had brunch here a few months ago and the first thing i noticed was it had no fry up??????Obviously to posh for that, so we had the smoked salmon to start - very expensive but tasty then the scrambled eggs with bacon. The bacon was streaky so rather fatty and the eggs had a unique taste i have no idea if it was cheese or sour cream or buttermilk perhaps?I wouldn't go back for brunch or perhaps try a different restaurant inside the hotel.

photos.caption: Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom. Bacon and scrambled eggs
Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom. Smoked salmon starter
Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom. Mocha

_9WNYktLSz81ECvaCxVl_A.text: One word: AWESOME!!!!!This hotel combines classic in modern in such an amazing way, I would describe myself as beholden. The entire place is a work of art and is an oasis of cool, hip and tranquility just a stone's throw from Piccadilly Circus. The lobby and common areas are all marble and stone, dimly lit, and oh, so sexy. The rooms are meticulously designed with minimal style but maximum comfort and efficiency.The spa with a modern gym, fitness rooms and DAZZLING pool are the perfect place to get in some relaxation, and there are amazing dining options at Ten Room, Oscar Wilde Bar, Domino, and the cafe.If you're in London and want to treat yourself to the best, look no further!

1Ndy8BaxVjfqSkjz-yvO2A.text: What a pleasant surprise!  Quite a few years have passed since I last visited the Cafe Royal; it used to be stuffy and old-fashioned - in a bad way.  Uninspiring mass catering for events and pretty awful service.What a transformation, the Cafe Royal has been transformed into a classy hotel with several bars and restaurants - and a cafe!  The tired velvet curtains have been replaced by modern panelling and the staff reflect the refreshed look.  It now does justice to the glorious building it is housed in, and to its name - fit for a queen!

photos.caption: Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom

pgaUHypb-EdH57V63Uujvg.text: For an expensive and luxury cafe one expects permission to relax and enjoy ones drink. I would argue that this is the absolute minimum requirement of such a venue. The service was continuously surly and the wait staff felt it reasonable to walk past every minute or so scowling at the table. I especially enjoyed the scorn received on asking for tap water to clean my palette. Really didn't make for a pleasant experience. The food and drink was beautifully presented, however I would have felt more relaxed and welcomed in the Starbucks just down the road. A disappointment.

photos.caption: Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom. Green Matcha Tea.

iTNsNKx8Rq4h62l0BGNsKw.text: This place is not cheap. However, it is impressive. Doormen push open doors for you and the service is swift and quick. The Oscar Wilde bar is probably one of the most opulently decorated bars in London. The amount of gold everywhere is insane - on the tables, chairs and the bar itself.In a place like this you feel you have to order champagne and if you're on a date you won't get change for £40. They threw in a few posh nuts and snacks but I'm not sure it was worth £40. If opulence is your thing then consider Beach Blanket Babylon, which is decorated in a similar style but cheaper.

photos.caption: Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom. Selfie in the Oscar Wilde bar - this place encourages posing :)

eei3bMWzja3yQXl2vXtemw.text: OMG. What a place. Sat at Oscar Wilde's table observing the crowd as I had my royally marvellous Champagne afternoon tea. It's not cheap, but it's the best experience you will get. Don't miss it!

photos.caption: Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom

m-whBIhddimNnQ0Y01-7Zg.text: This is a fabulous hotel in a great location. Unlike other nice hotels in the area, this is relatively new, with newly renovated and large room. You can beat the location for being in a fun part of London and close to all the shopping you could want. Service was great. This was my first time staying in this hotel but I will be a regular!

-D8R8HwYhW_9uTAgavs6Vw.text: Excellent!!!! Great location, Regent Street, and probably the best spa and hotel in central London with a complete gym, yoga and meditation rooms, sauna, steam and a substantial lap pool with beautiful mood lighting . The rooms are magnificent, large beautiful carerra marble bathrooms, excellent sound proofing . A very top London hotel ranking with the very best in the world.

photos.caption: Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom

QshqSmjJCusVu7Cz4BzxQA.text: Was a lovely afternoon with friends as we were visiting from the US.  We wanted to experience some tea and made a reservation for the Oscar Wilde room at Hotel Cafe Royal.  The sandwiches were quite boring and bland, and the desserts were more for show than for taste.  I HIGHLY recommend looking elsewhere for high tea, as this was not worth the 45 pound price tag.  There are far too many other choices that have better food.  Try Waterstone's fifth floor cafe.  We had tea there for 20pounds pp and it was amazing!  It was an incredible place, but just not worth the money.

8_uXQ86vL5LfD8jstQTtLA.text: I came here specifically for afternoon tea.  I'm traveling for work in London for the week and had done research on highly recommended afternoon tea places prior to visiting, when I came across Hotel Cafe Royal centrally located in SOHO.  Afternoon tea is served at the Oscar Wilde Bar located inside the hotel.  The staff was friendly and informative, considering I'm not a huge tea drinker but wanted to come for the experience and of course the finger foods.  The sandwiches were delicious and the desserts were amazing!  The waitress even came around to ask if there were any particular sandwiches I would like to get after having sampled everything.  I also tried two different types of tea while I was there.  The ambiance and mood was great.  There was even a live pianist who performed on Sunday.  I'd recommend the afternoon tea here for anyone who wants an authentic tea session.  Bonus points since I was also able to book this reservation thru OpenTable!

photos.caption: Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom. Room Decor
Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom. Afternoon tea
Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom. Desserts!

CYv1G2WlYYcVS7eOmUujow.text: Love the atmosphere in this tea room! Here  is lovely and relax for having some afternoon tea! Staffs are nice and well service, well train,well organize, and good service mind ' "thump up!" ( for ex: I cant finished my sweets asking for taking away end up with they pack it  in really good looking package! Service really worth for 12.5% service charged ) But the disappointment is your macarons is not good at all ...i will show on the picture review  However their another sweet is superb! Do Not miss their lovely amd yummy scones! Quite unique texture!

photos.caption: Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom. It doesn't taste yummy as its looks!
Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom. Looks!! How disappointed it is! The nice macarons should not have such a huge gap! Like that meaning ...failed
Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom. Their sweet is good and yummy

r0PG1FxqzzsxQuR9iaQdtg.text: This is one of the place that i use to bring my visitors from overseas. While having a touristic tour around Leicester Square, Piccadilly Circus, China Town its a nice place to have snack, desert and drinks. The place is fronting Regent Street so its a good spot take a break indeed. My favourite sandwich is smoked salmon, horseradish and rocket served in baguette. All prepared fresh. The food is prepared to right amount and space for desserts afterwards. Don't forget to try daily baked cakes.Very elegant and nice cafe. Superb clean toilets. Staff is usually polite. However, on our last attempt they did not allow us with pushchair although they enough space to accommodate us and we offered to fold it. So i think we had enough visits.

KJrlNli53_0eeot2Gd41zA.text: Wow what can I say about this place - best afternoon tea I have ever had! The hotel itself had amazing decor which I think is 18th century. From start to finish there was impeccable service (15% so I would expect so). There was so much food we couldn't eat it all and they offered to top up sandwiches and cakes. They offered palate cleansers in between and champagne was too good. Some afternoon teas can get boring with the food being a bit of the same, they had a really good selection of sandwiches and the cakes were amazing my favourite being apple crumble In a mini flower pot so cute! This place you must visit I'll be bAck

photos.caption: Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom

jfoZrERoMMrr-fnxdOngjg.text: Opulent surroundings if a little warm. Service was very good and the selection and quality of food great. The dark chocolate raspberry mousse 'truffle' was possibly the best chocolate dessert I have EVER tasted (& I've eaten a lot of chocolate!)Their house tea blend  (1865) was very good too.

VqOTxFet7dgT6cfViWJuGg.text: Amazing stay here in London. Conveniently located at Piccadilly Circus, just near Leicester Square, it is easy to spend the evening at the theater then grab a drink at the hotel bar. The rooms are very spacious and bathrooms a real luxury, with carved marble tubs and showers. The swimming pool is to die for (they even play underwater music!), I just wish it had later hours! :) really pleasant staff and I would highly recommend for couples traveling or business trips. The one not so great experience was that upon checkout, someone had charged a 185£ facial to our room! We were not happy and it took a while to get to the bottom of this. Other than that, lovely hotel and I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom. Swimming pool at the spa of the hotel Cafe Royal

758pq0Eb2k4FnjLSMHkaLw.text: I liked every thing about this hotel .. The design, the luxurious look, the friendly staff, and the location Every time I visit London this will be my number one choice

d58yotHrMoMLWQIgj2jfFg.text: The only reason this hotel does not get a 5 star review is the service in the main restaurant. The hotel staff are fantastic - the rooms outstanding and the valet and concierge outstanding. And the spa is one of the best in London - that does depend on who you get - but incredible - great gym - amazing pool - the actual cafe is also incredible

JndJ4a-CGo5WK6ESk8NQIw.text: I went with my girlfriend to celebrate our 5th year anniversary during our first trip to London. Juat by walking into the hotel lobby we knew we would have a great fine dinning experience, but we never expected the service to be so amazingly good. The food: We started with the Wagyu Nigiri, which is by far the best Nigiri we've ever had. For the main, we had the angus filet and the ribeye with sides of gratinated potatoes. The meat was cooked to perfection and the side was very tasty. The service: The food was amazing, but the service was just something you could only expect at the royal palace. We've been to many countries and to many fancy restaurants but we've never seen anything like this. The highlights1) We said "happy anniversary" to each other. One of the waiters overhead us and even prepared a lovely dessert for us. 2) Unfortunately, I started to fill dizzy mid dinner (nothing to do with the food or the restaurant). They noticed it and made sure I had water, sugar and fresh air and even walked me to the restroom. They were authenticly concerned which means a lot.3) Everyone was smiling at us, but the 3 most valuable players were the waitress (didn't get his name but he was from Bulgaria, extremely great service) , the bartender (he made a special drink for my girlfriend who doesn't drink alcohol, she LOVED it) and the general manager (Dinos), that made sure we got VIP treatment for our anniversary and also showed authentic empathy for my random health problem.I would recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting London, more than a dinner, it's an experience. Just go, it's a must.

WK73zt7blROcsWIlAvk0bg.text: This is a review for dinner. I noticed almost all other reviews were for the formal Tea service. Not sure why but go for dinner. It's very cool and an elegant setting, not stuffy.Overall 4.5 very strong. A unique approach. At first I thought it was a place that couldn't decide what it wanted to be. A complete sushi bar and offering with real Japanese sushi chefs. The menu also offered many seafood options, non sushi, in what is a real bar and grill. Yup. Sounds strange and isn't.This is London and we sat down about 8:30. Nothing really happens before 8 so if you're a typical American looking for the early bird you'll have the whole place to yourself at 7pm. Funny because in the US 7- 7:30 are coveted res times.Started with lobster sushi rolls. I copied the menu so you'll have an idea of how they're prepared. These are fantastic. Fresh as can be. Comes with 6 pieces. Very rich. A good split dish. Next, the Kale salad which my wife described as Super Food-- and loved it. As most of you know it's next to impossible to get a vegetable in Europe unless it's a side you order. I had the little gem salad. Very simple dish, superb ingredients light and tasty dressing. For mains I had the short rib, my wife had fish. Both were outstanding -- the only miscue of the night was temperature of the fish was Luke Warm. Not worth sending back. I couldn't eat it all it was so rich.As mentioned the cocktails are excellent, a large array of most any spirts you can imagine-- anyone for a little Louis XIII? Great wine list with knowledgeable servers, wine Som.Couldn't even look at the dessert list as we were very satisfied - the did Bring some comp chocolates with the check. We'd go back in NY minute.

photos.caption: Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom. My favorite, Manhattan
Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom. The amazing bar inside the restaurant dining area
Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom. Menu

qaYOasgh3BXaK9UXc-DoXA.text: Beautiful hotel.  We didn't stay here, but from what I could see it would be a great place to stay.  We came here for high tea and I checked into the hotel but later realized that we were in the Oscar Wilde Bar room.  That is where they serve high tea.When you walk into the hotel, you enter into a large area with a fireplace on each side.  There's a beautiful center table decorated with different flowers.You will then see a spiral staircase going up several floors.Even if you don't stay the night in this hotel, you should walk in to see the inside.

photos.caption: Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom. Spiral staircase
Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom. Entryway, with the flowers

typvtd8-SWOjGghyTLUtzg.text: This is a review of the high tea. First off, the tearoom is gorgeous and ornate. You feel transported to a fancy room in a palace. A pianist played nearly nonstop with classic music, covers from UK artists and random fun (think: Game of Thrones theme). But I have to admit that I was disappointed with our food at the tea and would not recommend it! We opted for the champagne tea, which started us off with a glass of bubbly for an extra £10. That was really good. They have a large selection of teas and suggest that you switch flavors for the savory and sweet courses. We used a lot of sugar and had to ask a few times for a refill. The menu was surprisingly adjustable. As a vegetarian, I was brought a few alternate choices and they had gluten free bread and desserts for our friend. Much appreciated. Aside from the tarragon egg salad, none of the sandwiches were anything to rave about. One of my vegetarian options were plain grilled bell peppers on bread. I appreciate the effort but it had no flavor. No one was particularly excited about the rest either. Luckily, we had a lovely server! He offered to bring us more egg salad and cucumber sandwiches. I'm glad he did because the desserts were prettier than they were tasty. We each tried a small bite of each tart or pastry but barely ate them. (As we walked in, I noticed a party had left behind much of their dessert. I had assumed they were full but now I think they had the same opinion.) It's one thing to have a dainty tea but it's another to spend $80 on a "snack" that didn't live up to expectation.  We were hungry 1-2 hours later. With all the trays of little sandwiches and treats, we should have at least left sated. I think I'd rather lunch at the cafe next door to pick out one, good dessert and a glass of champagne - or two!

DthaNMI9aaoB1rrq8rW2ig.text: Gorgeous spot for afternoon tea, even Oscar Wilde thought so! The gilded room and live music are nice but the actual tea and treats are great, and the service is absolutely spectacular. We tried a few other places that either had very strict dress codes or required reservations, but HCR had availability for a last-minute res on Open Table and welcomed us in despite being in more casual attire.Their exclusive tea blends are diverse, and our group tried the Oscar (toasty!), Triple Mint (refreshing!), and Golden Caryatid (malty, with pearls!), all of which were tasty in their own way. My favorite bite of the food was the chef's amuse bouche, a goat cheese and pickled apple muffin with a bulb of apple juice. The sandwiches were nicely savory, particularly the coronation chicken. Next was a course of scones and clotted cream, which were warm and had a great texture. All of the desserts were almost too beautiful to eat, but so supremely delicious- particularly the apple and Tahitian vanilla caramel tart. As tasty as all the treats were, I still keep coming back to the service being what made it truly excellent- our servers were attentive and we were treated with the utmost professionalism and the live music was an excellent touch. Though the OWB room was beautiful, I wish the lighting were better for photos, which unfortunately didn't really turn out.

photos.caption: Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom. Strawberry thing
Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom. Best damn macaron
Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom. Inside apple tart

OS3cu_xLlVU_pFUSXpd5xw.text: Great location by Piccadilly and close to shops and theaters. Friendly employees...beautiful pool in the basement ...  great fully equipped gym which is not big but fully functional...nice rooms.

IWeopG0k4_RaIlIMVjqM9Q.text: When you think of london, england - you think of their British tea & their renowned high teas! Had the opportunity to check out this high tea with my mom & enjoyed the overall experience. Beautiful decor of the cafe with excellent service. The food on the other hand was nothing spectacular unfortunately. Did enjoy the overall experience & the tea! Its a great way to take a mini snack/tea break after shopping!

photos.caption: Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom. afternoon tea!
Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom

UVlvqJCnMx9WQpoNvUw4rQ.text: We came to enjoy their afternoon tea in the ornate Oscar Wilde lounge. Cafe Royal was awarded "Best Traditional Afternoon Tea" in 2017, and it certainly lived up to its award. From the beautifully decorated gilded room with mirrors and painted ceilings; it felt like a room from another era. Additionally, there was a pianist who played nonstop for almost 2 hours. What better way to start the afternoon tea experience. Our server suggested to select 2 types of tea. One to enjoy with the tea sandwiches and a more fruity one to enjoy with the scones and pastries. The tea sandwiches were the traditional ones such as cucumber, egg salad, smoked salmon, chicken salad and ham. Scones were traditional as well with plain and raisin options. All tea sandwiches and scones were delicious and we ordered a second helping of both. The pastries were the only thing on the menu not as traditional and for us, they were not as delicious which was fine because we were so full by this time. I should also mention that children receive a 50% discount off the menu as well as an option to order hot chocolate instead of tea. My son is allergic to cheese, so they made him special tea sandwiches. Service was very accommodating. We enjoyed our authentic British tea experience in this gorgeous room, would highly recommend to all.

photos.caption: Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom

XxS5fIECJBvcfyM5JtCGEQ.text: Came here for high tea with my friend Rachel and had an absolute blast! The decor is amazing, and they set the ambience with a wonderful piano player. Our waitress was very polite, professional, and sweet. We enjoyed a glass of champagne, 2 different teas, and a variety of tea sandwiches + sweets! My friend wasn't thrilled with most of the sandwiches, but the waitress kindly offered to bring out more of the cucumber ones she liked which was really sweet. She also let us know we were seated at Princess Diana's favorite table, which made the experience all the more memorable. It was pricey but a great experience, highly recommended for high tea.

photos.caption: Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom

Hcyc6Q61BVON8LM6uD2nEA.text: I brought my Mum here for a lovely afternoon tea.  Although they have a cafe next to the hotel entrance, the actual Afternoon Tea is served in the Oscar Wilde Bar, so you should use the main hotel entrance.The staff are very pleasant and although we arrived a few minutes before they opened, after we put our coats in the cloakroom, we were ushered into the restaurant straight away.There is a mountain of tea to choose from.  Our tastes are pretty ordinary so it was not long before we had 2 pots of tea on the table and a stand of assorted savory treats were before us shortly thereafter.  The cakes and scones came out next and since everything is so filling they were very gracious in boxing up what we could not eat and letting us bring it home.Needless to say everything was delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom. The cake stand!

CBALpA26Pu7_28-r62XXkQ.text: Desserts for dinner! What more could you want!We went in a group to experience the lovely dessert menu options they offer. The menu offers several three, four and five course selections, with optional wine pairing, to choose from. And boy, is it hard to choose! Everything sounds so delicious.I chose the 3-course Memories Of A Child menu, which at the time included Gaspacho, Yozu Yogurt and a strawberry and cream lollipop. The atmosphere is quite airy and relaxed, so we chatted while eagerly awaiting our food.The Gaspacho came with "molecular gastronomy" style olive oil beads and olive crumble, delicately arranged on the Burrata, which unfortunately was swept and drowned in the cold soup they served on top. The watermelon and tomato paired very well together, the soup was slightly greasy and a bit oversalted, especially paired with an already salty ham and cheese pairing. The Yozu Yogurt was amazing, delicately flavoured Lego style bricks that were light and fluffy. Served with crunchy meringues, velvety sherbert, smooth lemon curd and a tangy lemon crumble. While the plate looked slightly messy, the tastes and textures were absolutely fantastic. This was definitely my favourite dish.The strawberry lollipop wasn't quite what we expected. The wooden lollipop stick came out immediately and didn't hold the almost runny dessert at all, making it impossible to pick it up and nibble away. As soon as the cold strawberry flavoured crust was broken, the creamy dessert inside ran all over the place. Awkwardly picking it up with the spoon worked to manoeuvre a mixture of creamy vanilla and poached strawberries into one's oral cavity. The following taste sensation definitely made it worth the effort of trying to eat this mess without spilling it everywhere. The dishes were definitely aimed at pleasing the eye, but the tastes and textures were not completely neglected. I did feel the price was a touch too high for what was offered and we ended up having seven meals on our bill when there were only six of us. This was corrected eventually, but only after we were accused of not paying our bill fully.Overall it was definitely an experience worth splurging on, I'll be back to sample more of their delicate creations!

photos.caption: Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom. Scrumptious AND pretty!

GBDyYSuaHsTB5La7UmnZvQ.text: Afternoon tea here was absolutely amazing. We had tea in the Oscar Wilde room and it was an actual fairytale. The service was outstanding and the tea and food selections were so yummy. They even give you a gift bag at the end. This experience was worth every penny and would do it again 100%.

K4W7cq7zkaCB4v04z_XGtw.text: I came here for a pre-theatre meal with my family to celebrate my sister's birthday. It's a nice space with interesting costumes and art around the place. Service was fast.I had the yellowfin tuna nicoise which was an elevated version of this salad (see picture). Beautifully seared tuna with a small quails egg, olives, green beans, salad leaves and a little fondant potato. Lovely ingredients though needed a little more seasoning. Overall would recommend BUT quite expensive for what it is. Only one vegetarian option offered too.We used a gourmet society card for 25% off total bill so ultimately good value. Not worth the money full price thouh.

photos.caption: Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom. Tuna nicoise - great presentation

hmyJNF6MXISPiwi_py5CrA.text: Top notch world class hotel. I've very much enjoyed my stay here especially the part where everyone knew my name and greeted me with a smile.  I got a suite here and loved it. When I checked in the front desk lady actually walked me into my room to make sure it was to my liking.  The room had no pictures hung but the architecture itself was a work of art.  My two favorite things about the room was the huge shower and heated floors.The windows were doubled up to prevent any street noise from coming in.  Everything is pricey here but they have the service to back it up. My breakfast was delicious and concierge goes out of their way to get you anything you need.  You really felt that the staff has your best interest in mind.My only disappointment was the afternoon tea I had here.  I didn't really enjoy the taste of the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom

AbiJfxFIfezMqprUOkBI7A.text: My absolute favorite hotel to stay in everytime in Londontown exquisite in every sense!

ceVYG8cCSEtuC0kDnQN0Sg.text: Wow what can I say but I went along to The Café in Hotel Café Royal to experience their desserts that they sell and what can I say but WOW.  I went along with some Yelp friends which made the whole experience even better as the company alone was great. Now about the desserts what can I say but wow wow wow the desserts that was served was amazing looking alone with lego brick type moose and lollipop looking dessert made out of strawberry moose but the taste was a massive explosion on the tongue with its tanginess and sharpness all what a girl expects from a dessert.  Not bland at all super sweet and tangy I highly recommend if you want a dessert that is tangy and not bland and gives you  a explosion of taste sensation in your mouth.  Go along!

photos.caption: Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom

oDTHUrn7CQGqK8mln7J3OQ.text: Afternoon tea for 3 please with champagne. The afternoon tea was lovely but forgettable. The staff were lovely and informative and attentive. The decor was amazing but the food was left to be desired. The sandwiches were a bit boring and the deserts were the same. The scones were delicious and warm and the clotted cream as always is good. Unfortunately the desserts were a bit forgettable. The sandwiches were nice, but nothing to write home about. Honestly its was mostly the service and the decor that make this place what it is, besides the company you keep of course.

DpJrGCd0-bHpAdY4-T3Pmw.text: I goto afternoon tea everywhere I go and this is definitely one of the better ones I have been to. The Macaron was amazing and they delivered so much food. Too much food, but an amazing variety. The service was excellent, the pianist was excellent a s the décor was... Interesting! I'd definitely go back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom. Sandwiches at afternoon tea
Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom. Afternoon tea goodies

P7AMobpBhQl39r-pWEAMCw.text: They have the best window displays dont they?Thought id mention that.Anyway, I came here for their new alice and wonderland themed menu and well, i cant say i left missing my front hairs from having been blown away by wonderful tastes. I paid around £40 for the 4 course and by the second course i wanted out of the commitment id made! Everything was too sweet and in my opinion lacked delicate plating.One of my desserts came with a thick of scoop of caramel, i mean what was i meant to do with it? build a house or use it as hair gel? i can only assume it had another purpose since there was so much of it.The queen of hearts was my favourite, champagne and berries. whats there not to like?Overall i think this place is over priced based on the basic desserts theyre serving. you can get most of it in any dessert shop for half the price and nicer flavours.Its a shame because the staff were lovely and extremely attentive.would i go back? No.

photos.caption: Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hotel Cafe Royal - London, United Kingdom

_GyP_y-8Q-r_ilmF_2J8hQ.text: This girl right here has a sweet tooth and so when I heard about their new Alice In Wonderland themed menu I just had to add it to my birthday plans...We were greated like royalty.. And offered a glass of champagne on arrival ... Haha how did they know? Who let it slip? I am a champagne enthusiast!! Anyways as their tables are small and the larger ones were taken my friends and I sat separately but within reach! We all had the 4 course meal!! I chose allllllll desserts because it'd be stupid not to lol.. Started off with the Jaffa cake and white chocolate mushrooms on top of cookie crumb soil... Beautiful on the eyes and in the mouth!!!Course 2: the Eat Me Drink Me- which was a snickers inspired dessert! Very delcious however I was almost sugared out at this point ..my eye twitched and my vein on my left arm pulsed vigorously!!! Still I powered on! Course 3: The Queen Of Hearts (Champagne And Roses) - my favourite of the four for sure! It had everything !!! Delicious rose petals champagne foam dust of some sugary sort .. I mean wow .. Course 4: The Mad Hatter - this dessert was alcoholic through and through and I loved it haha! The cherry compote pipe was so yummy and though the cherry pieces were very sweet the alcohol balanced it out!! Only thing I wasn't crazy about was the moose thing on my plate ..the texture didn't sit well with me but apart from that I was in sugar heaven!!! Price wise £42-60 but that's if you're going for over 3 courses  Impeccable service and delicious desserts ..I was a happy girl indeed!
